snippet: American investigators say that records covering more than four years may have been shredded.
abstract: Report to be published by the Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction finds that more than four years of financial records, covering about $475 million worth of fuel purchases for the Afghan National Army, may have been shredded, raising concerns about potential fraud; agency also says that that no proper system is in place for estimating the Afghan Army's future fuel requirements, as control over the fuel spending budget is about to be increased and handed over from United States and NATO authority to the Afghan government.
lead_paragraph: American investigators say that records covering more than four years may have been shredded.

headline.main: Records Missing on Afghan Army Fuel Costs
headline.print_headline: Records Missing on Afghan Army Fuel Costs
